ygData.subject: relative URL issuse
ygData.msgSnippet: According to rfc1808.txt a relative url ../testDotDot.html with a base http://test.com should be constructed to absolute URL

Subject: relative URL issuse
Message-ID: <Pine.LNX.4.33.0306201213330.30238-100000@...>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
From: Igor Ranitovic <igor@...>
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137477665

According to rfc1808.txt a relative url "../testDotDot.html" with a base 
"http://test.com" should be constructed to absolute URL 
"http://test.com/../testDotDot.html"

Rule:
c) All occurrences of "<segment>/../", where <segment> is a
              complete path segment not equal to "..", are removed.
              Removal of these path segments is performed iteratively,
              removing the leftmost matching pattern on each iteration,
              until no matching pattern remains.
 
Unfortunately, browsers (I tested IE, Opera, and Mozilla) in this case will 
remove ../ and construct the following 
absolute URL "http://test.com/testDotDot.html"
Therefore we will want to loose above rule so that if complete <segment> 
is equal to ../, ../ will be removed.

Just to keep in mind the all these browser have different policies on 
absolute URL where path begins with /../ (see 
http://crawl08.archive.org/testdotdot.html examples)
IE does not change the URL.
Opera changes the URL.
Mozilla does not change the URL

i.
